Authors:
Micael Ferreira Gonçalves, Ana Aleixo, Tânia Vicente, Ana
Esteves, Artur Alves
Title:
Three new species of Neocamarosporium isolated from saline
environments: N. aestuarinum sp. nov., N. endophyticum sp. nov. and N.
halimiones sp. nov.
Abstract:
Neocamarosporium genus is a recent taxon that was
introduced in 2014 by Crous et al. These species (Neocamarosporiaceae,
Pleosporales) are typically halotolerant and can be found in association
with saline niches, like terrestrial plants as halophytes, saline water
or even hypersaline soils. In this study, we introduce three novel
species isolated from Halimione portulacoides, saline water and dead
leaves of Zostera noltii of two saline environments analysing their
morphology and phylogeny based on ITS sequences. However, it is
essential a combination of sequence data using more specific genes for a
robust phylogenetic analysis and species delimitation to resolve these
taxa. N. aestuarinum, N. endophyticum and N. halimiones are provided
with morphological descriptions and compared with phylogenetically close
species.
